Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of woman in revealing dress. Legs crossed. Base fragment broken at waist. Hollow, pressed into one-piece mould, then plain back added. Soft (gypsum?) white coating without any trace of paint left. Nile silt brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, clay pellets and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Orginally ascribed a classical date, but more likely one of the Naukratis terracottas dated 3rd to 2nd century BC, with similar example dated early 2nd century BC (Fischer 1994, pl.8. no.51). Thought (in register) to represent Aphrodite, though this is not certain. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.392) (Phase 1)
